item.title: Surface Book 2 came back, let's see if I still have USB and WiFi issues
item.description:
Pontifications

  • Surface Book 2 came back!
  • Looks to be a new unit or refurb, let's see if I still have USB and WiFi issues as I did with the previous Surface Book 2!

item.title: Epson 'Ecotank' ET-2750 stopped printing, jams every time and a spring fell out
item.description:
Pontifications

  • Epson 'Ecotank' ET-2750 stopped printing, jams every time and a spring fell out! oops! it apparently has a 1 year warranty. I'll see if I can get it fixed under warranty.
  • Up until it now when it jams every time it's been reliable!

item.title: I'm enjoying using Dropbox Paper on my own without collaborating
item.description:
Pontifications

  • I'm enjoying using Dropbox Paper on my own without collaborating! Why because it's beautiful and functional.
  • Great for a "tickler" file!

item.title: Firefox on OS X is slower than Firefox on Windows
item.description:
Pontifications

  • Having switched temporarily back to OS X from Windows 10, I can say that Firefox on OS X is slower than Firefox on Windows
  • Photo software like Lumen for the Light 16 however is faster on OS X! Why? Better graphics frameworks like Core Image?

item.title: Self Driving Cars and Uber's software: Decisions made by engineers and managers to prioritize comfort of passengers over unreliable false positive detection algorithms
item.description:
Pontifications

"[I hate this framing. It's not the software that failed, it's the engineers who designed the software that failed. Decisions made by engineers and managers to prioritize comfort of passengers over unreliable false positive detection algorithms is the real story here.](https://twitter.com/skip_sf/status/999782839657758720)"
  • I have a feeling this kind of issue is going to come up more and more. Need government regulation to ensure safety for everyone including pedestrians and bicyclists.

item.title: Periodic reminder: Computer software is full of bugs and hard to create and modify
item.description:
Pontifications

Just in case anybody forgot :-) :

  • Coding a command line script that 1 person uses, usually the person writing it, is easy.
  • Coding a mass market app means lots of bugs and it is hard to create and modify apps.
  • Our greatest failure is our failure to communicate the above two statements.
  • Hopefully this will change in the future and we'll have secure, true software components that make software development for the masses pleasant and easy.

item.title: Hugo has an import from jekyll command
item.description:
Pontifications

  • Hugo has an import from jekyll command which means that if it works I'll probably move this blog to hugo before the end of 2018 :-)

item.title: Speed is a feature! I forgot how fast hugo is compared to jekyll
item.description:
Pontifications

  • Now I am dreaming of converting rolandtanglao.com to hugo from jekyll (because of speed which I realized from working on rollingroland.com last night)

item.title: You can use euro-roaming if you have a European address
item.description:
Pontifications

  • To follow up from yesterday's Know Roaming post, Know Roaming Sim Sticker for Canadians - highly recommended, you can use euro-roaming if you have a European address. So use KR for the first day, and then get a SIM mailed to your European address?!?! I guess this only works for long visits, i.e. longer than 2 weeks where you actually have a European address where you can receive mail.

item.title: Know Roaming Sim Sticker for Canadians - highly recommended
item.description:
Pontifications

  • Not sure about Android but I've used the Know Roaming Sim Sticker in the USA, France and Germany without any issues on iPhone. Highly recommended!
